page.title: 01Williamston Common
page.content: The South Tyne cuts deeply through the entrence W of the block, with cultivated grassland and scattered farmhouses. East of the valley the land rises steeply to the rough heather and peat-cropped hills, 250m above the river. In the SE corner, Barhaugh Burn and its tributes from a deep valley whose slopes have many disused mineworkings, and are covered with rough grazing. There are extensive larch plantations in the cloughs in the SE, and pine plantations around Snope Burn in the extreme north. The area has approximately 20 inhabitants, all farm families living in the Tyne Valley. Cattle are grazed on the laughs & sheep on the fell.
